title: State Coordination of Regional and Local Economic Development Projects Amendments
description: State Coordination of Regional and Local Economic Development Projects Amendments

House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill addresses local and regional economic development projects.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the State Reinvestment Restricted Account (account);<hr><ltbullet>directs the Utah Inland Port Authority to deposit certain revenues into the account;<hr><ltbullet>modifies certain requirements for a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>provides a process for the dissolution of a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>requires the disclosure of the expected expected annual cost of a public infrastructure district's final tax rate, as shown on the last equalized assessment rolls, in the conveyance of residential real property, if applicable;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to deposit revenue, in certain circumstances, into the account;<hr><ltbullet>creates a process for a county or city to propose a regionally significant development zone (zone) and for a committee to approve the creation of a zone;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a zone to capture and utilize certain forms of tax increment;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a county to levy an energy tax within a zone, under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>describes how a zone will be managed, including how a community reinvestment agency (agency) will manage zone funds, prepare zone budgets, conduct zone audits, and make biennial reports;<hr><ltbullet>describes the circumstances in which an agency shall transfer a percentage of zone revenue into the account;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a housing and transit reinvestment zone, first home investment zone, home ownership promotion zone, or major sporting event venue zone may not be created after January 1, 2028;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity (GOEO) to collect certain information from a regional economic development authority about the use of tax increment;<hr><ltbullet>requires GOEO to maintain, or cause to be maintained, a public-facing website where information about local and regional use of tax increment may be found;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the prohibition on local government offering a financial incentive for an energy development project outside an electrical energy development zone; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
